title: How to introduce a philosophy essay - Quora

response.answer_text: Here’s a few short cuts that help set up your roughest draft. 1. Write a general introduction but, NEVER EXPLAIN. Tell your reader what you are about to discuss and (maybe a fraction as to why) 2. Literally write “three things” as a list of sub-categories. NEVER EXPLAIN. 3. Get your reader into the first Body Paragraph: “Let’s take a closer look.” or throw down that thesis statement. [Note: Topic Sentence (one of “three things”) Lead → . “Quote” . ← Retell . Elaborate . Lead → . etc… Conclusion . ] Now, rewrite and get out of your old writing habits; break your own rules for the fun of informing and entertaining your reader and your (+) ethical/poetic/reasonable “self” or (-) not…
